com.fincons.rabbitmq.client
Class BasicRabbitMqClient

java.lang.Object
  com.fincons.rabbitmq.client.BasicRabbitMqClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
RabbitMqClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicPublisher, BasicSubscriber
public abstract class BasicRabbitMqClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements RabbitMqClient

Defines an abstract implementation of the RabbitMqClient interface.
This implementation is abstract because a generic client is useless because can only connect and disconnect to the RabbitMQ Server but cannot use the session. Subclasses (i.e. classes that models publishers and subscribers) should use the operative broker's connection parameters to connect to RabbitMQ resource they have been authorised to access and publish or subscribe to an event stream.

Author:
Fincons Group AG

Method Summary
 void connect()
          Sets up a communication session between this client and RabbitMQ Server.
 void disconnect()
          Quits the communication session between this client and the RabbitMQ Server.
 boolean isConnected()
          States if this client is connected to the RabbitMQ server (i.e. the session is alive).

Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
Description copied from interface: RabbitMqClient
Sets up a communication session between this client and RabbitMQ Server.
If no exception has been thrown, the client is authorised to connect to the operative broker and a session is started.

Specified by:
